H0.text: Wind speed is what a barometer measures when a meteorologist announces that the barometer reading is dropping.

H1.text: Air pressure is what a barometer measures, as shown when a meteorologist announces that the barometer reading is dropping.

H2.text: Air temperature is what a barometer measures, as indicated when a meteorologist announces a dropping barometer reading.

H3.text: Ground temperature is what a barometer measures, as indicated by the meteorologistâ€™s announcement that the barometer reading is dropping.

A4.text: A barometer is a scientific instrument that is used to measure air pressure.

A5.text: Pressure tendency can forecast short term changes in the weather.
